channel.title: Docker.com on .NET Ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in Docker.com on .NET Ramblings

item.title: Get started with the latest updates for Dockerfile syntax (v1.7.0)
item.description: Dockerfiles are fundamental tools for developers working with Docker, serving as a blueprint for creating Docker images. Learn about new Dockerfile (v1.7.0) capabilities and how you can leverage them in your projects to further optimize your Docker workflows. Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/new-dockerfile-capabilities-v1-7-0/

item.title: Debianâ€™s Dedication to Security: A Robust Foundation for Docker Developers
item.description: We outline how and why Debian operates as a secure basis for development and makes a good choice for Docker Official Images. Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/debian-for-docker-developers/

item.title: From Misconceptions to Mastery: Enhancing Security and Transparency with Docker Official Images
item.description: Docker Official Images are an important component of Docker's commitment to the security of both the software supply chain and open source software. We address three common misconceptions about Docker Official Images and outline seven ways they help secure the software supply chain. Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/enhancing-security-and-transparency-with-docker-official-images/

item.title: KubeCon EU 2024: Highlights from Paris
item.description: If you stopped by the KubeCon EU 2024 Docker booth, you may have seen our Megennis Motorsport Racing experience. Or you may have talked to one of our engineers about our new fast Docker Build Cloud experience. We round up a few other highlights from Paris. Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/kubecon-eu-2024-highlights-from-paris/
